channel.title: win32 on anyicomplex's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in win32 on anyicomplex's Blog

item.title: Writing and Compiling win32 Programs under Linux
item.description: The term “win32” in this article is the common name for winapi in mainland China programmers' circles, not specifically for 32-bit winapi (not to mention 64-bit, we also calling the earlier 16-bit winapi “win32” since the appearance of 32-bit winapi). Feasibility Thanks to the MinGW (Minimalist GNU for Windows) project, it is perfectly feasible to compile win32 applications as long as not involve higher-level packaging (MFC, WPF, etc.). (There are actually various tricks to use MFC and WPF, but I don’t recommend it, and if you want to do that, it might be better to use MSVC under Wine)
